intro: Linnaea adenotricha, commonly known as the hairy yellow twinflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern Appalachian Mountains in the United States. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories, preferring rich, well-drained soils. Linnaea adenotricha is an important component of the local flora and plays a role in supporting pollinators during the spring season.
